values.text:
I didn't understand your question. You can try rephrasing or you may contact us using one of the followings options:
1) Make an Appointment with us.
2) Email Us..
3)If you're dialing from Singapore, you can contact us at 1800 333 0333 from Mondays to Fridays, 8:30am to 5:30pm 4)If you're dialing from overseas or via a payphone, you can contact us at +65 6333 0333.

values.text:
PRUMum is a single premium 4-year maternity term protection plan with comprehensive coverage for both you and your little one. With 4 sum assured coverage options, PRUMum aims to provide the protection you and your baby need.
Coverage includes pregnancy complications, congenital illnesses, mental wellness care, gestational diabetes mellitus, and hospital care benefits.
Want to learn more about PRUMum , head down to this link. If you have any enquiry, please call your financial consultant or our PRUCustomer Line at 1800 333 0 333 or Email Us..

PRULady is a unique health insurance plan thatâ€™s specially tailored to cover illnesses which afflict women. It is a comprehensive plan that covers you through every stage of your life. Enjoy coverage for procedures such as reconstructive surgery and post-diagnostic support. Want to learn more about PRULady, head down to this link. If you have any enquiry, please call your financial consultant or our PRUCustomer Line at 1800 333 0 333 or Email Us..

PRUSafe Dengue is a microinsurance plan with a 3-month term, that covers you against dengue fever. It is highly affordable and conveniently available to purchase within the Pulse by Prudential app with just a few clicks. Want to learn more about PRUSafe Dengue, head down to this link. If you have any enquiry, please call your financial consultant or our PRUCustomer Line at 1800 333 0 333 or Email Us..

PRUCash Secure offers you financial security and peace of mind with guaranteed savings upon maturity so you can better plan for your future. With PRUCash Secure, you can pay off your premiums in just 5 years, while being financially protected for an additional 10 years. During this time, you enjoy access to your yearly cash payout, whether it is to indulge yourself with a new hobby or treat your family to a well-deserved holiday. PRUCash Secure not only guarantees you 100% of your savings upon maturity but also provides additional returns in the form of nonguaranteed benefits. Want to learn more about PRUCash Secure, head down to this link. If you have any enquiry, please call your financial consultant or our PRUCustomer Line at 1800 333 0 333 or Email Us..

PRUSelect Vantage is an investment-linked insurance plan that helps you build and diversify your portfolio from a wide range of carefully researched and quality funds. Designed to make the most of your investments, we tap on the internationally acknowledged investment expertise of Mercer Investments (â€œMercerâ€), a leading global provider of investment consulting services, so that you can always be on the market pulse. Offering you the option to invest in PRUSelect Vantage through regular premium payments depending on your risk profile and objectives, this plan empowers you to steer towards your financial aspirations. Want to learn more about PRUSelect Vantage, head down to this link. If you have any enquiry, please call your financial consultant or our PRUCustomer Line at 1800 333 0 333 or Email Us..

PRUSelect Vantage Premier is an investment-linked insurance plan that helps you build and diversify your portfolio from a wide range of carefully researched and quality funds. Designed to make the most of your investments, we tap on the internationally acknowledged investment expertise of Mercer Investments (â€œMercerâ€), a leading global provider of investment consulting services, so that you can always be on the market pulse. Offering you the option to invest in single premium lump sum for PRUSelect Vantage Premier, depending on your risk profile and objectives, this plan empowers you to steer towards your financial aspirations. Want to learn more about PRUSelect Vantage Premier, head down to this link. If you have any enquiry, please call your financial consultant or our PRUCustomer Line at 1800 333 0 333 or Email Us..

dialog_nodes.title: choose making payment using credit card

values.text:
Making payment online using Credit Card.
To set up a recurring payment for your regular premium policies in Singapore dollars, you may enrol a Credit card. Your options are:
1)PRUAccess
Login to your PRUAccess account.
Select your desired Policy Number
Select E-Transaction for this policy
Select Change Payment Method to Credit Card
Proceed to enrol
2)iPay
Log in to iPay.
Select Credit card Enrolment
Select your desired policy number(s)
Click to agree and acknowledge the terms and conditions, then proceed to enrol
iPay will redirect you to the credit card payment page. Please proceed to enter your credit card details
Enter the OTP sent from the bank to complete the transaction
Making one time payment using Credit Card.
You may make payment via Credit card by logging to iPay
Log in to iPay.
Select Make payment via iPay
Select your desired Policy Number(s) and verify the payment amount
Select Credit card as the payment method
iPay will redirect you to credit card payment page. Please proceed to enter your credit card details
Enter the OTP sent from bank to complete the transaction
If you have any enquiry, please call your financial consultant or our PRUCustomer Line at 1800 333 0 333 or Email Us..

Making payment using PayNow.
You may make payment via PayNow by logging to iPay. Log in to iPay.
Select Make payment via iPay
Select your desired Policy Number(s) and verify the payment amount
Select PayNow as the payment method
Payment details and a QR code will be generated
Separately, login into your banking app
Scan the QR code or upload a screenshot of the QR code using the â€˜Scan and Payâ€™ function in your banking app
Ensure the merchantâ€™s name is (PRUDENTIAL ASSURANCE COMPANY (S) PTE LTD) and payment amount is correct
Proceed to confirm the payment
If you have any enquiry, please call your financial consultant or our PRUCustomer Line at 1800 333 0 333 or Email Us..

PRUMan is a unique health plan thatâ€™s especially tailored to cover illnesses which afflict men. It is a comprehensive plan that covers through every stage of your life. It also offers biennial medical screening to ensure early detection. Want to learn more about PRUMan, head down to this link. If you have any enquiry, please call your financial consultant or our PRUCustomer Line at 1800 333 0 333 or Email Us..

PRUSafe BreastCancer is an affordable cancer insurance plan that provides women aged 19 â€“ 39 with coverage against the top female cancer. A 12-month automatically renewable plan2 that can be purchased easily via the Pulse by Prudential app, aims to provide you with peace of mind so that you can DO life to the fullest. Want to learn more about PRUSafe BreastCancer, head down to this link. If you have any enquiry, please call your financial consultant or our PRUCustomer Line at 1800 333 0 333 or Email Us..

PRUActive Retirement can help you do just that. Itâ€™s a unique plan that's highly customisable, designed to give you flexibility, financial security, and therefore freedom to retire the way you want. It's a first-of-its-kind retirement plan designed to weather market volatility, providing you with a steady cumulative retirement income. Want to learn more about PRUActive Retirement, head down to this link. If you have any enquiry, please call your financial consultant or our PRUCustomer Line at 1800 333 0 333 or Email Us..

PRUFlexi Cash is a long-term insurance savings plan that offers you protection against unforeseen circumstances and gives you the flexibility to use your Yearly Cash Benefit for your lifestyle needs such as pampering your loved ones with a holiday, whenever you need. If you choose not to use the Yearly Cash Benefit, you can accumulate it with us for an annual interest. Want to learn more about PRUFlexi Cash, head down to this link. If you have any enquiry, please call your financial consultant or our PRUCustomer Line at 1800 333 0 333 or Email Us..

Criteria for Nomination. Under the Insurance Act, policy owners can nominate beneficiaries for their insurance policies at the time of buying a policy or at any time after the policy is issued. All of the following criteria must be met before a policyowner can consider making a nomination:
1)The policy must be a life policy or an accident and health policy that provide death benefits, and
2)The policy must be effected by the policyowner on his or her own life. The policyowner must be at least age 18 years to be eligible to make a nomination.
If the insurance policy falls under any of the following categories, nomination of beneficiary under the Insurance Act is not allowed.
1)The policy is purchased under the Minimum Sum Scheme (MSS)
2)The policy is effected by the policy owner to insure another life assured
3)The policy is placed on trust
4)The policy does not have a death benefit. eg. All PruShield plans
If you like to make a nomination, you must read and have understood Life Insurance Association (LIA), Singapore's Your Guide to the Nomination of Insurance Nominees. before making any nomination. Where do you submit your Nomination form You must submit the completed original nomination form and copies of identification documents and mandatory requirements of your beneficiaries and trustees to Prudential Assurance Company Singapore (Pte) Limited via the following ways: By Post to: Prudential Assurance Company Singapore (Pte) Limited Robinson Road P.O. Box 492 Singapore 900942 By Hand to: Prudential Customer Service Centre at Marina One The Heart #01-18/19, 5 Straits View Singapore 018935 If you have any enquiry, please call your financial consultant or our PRUCustomer Line at 1800 333 0 333 or Email Us..

How do I sign up for PayNow ?
To register for PayNow using your NRIC/FIN, please log in to your bankâ€™s internet or mobile banking account to sign up for this service. For more information and steps to sign up, please contact your bank or check out the FAQs provided by the various participating banks below:
POSB.
OCBC
SC
UOB
BOC
Citi
HSBC
ICBC
Maybank
Receiving pay out via PayNow.
With this service, you can receive future payouts from your policies, such as refunds, claims, withdrawal, and more, via PayNow. If you have already signed up for PayNow service with your bank, using your NRIC or FIN, you can opt in to receive future payouts via PayNow. Instead of waiting for cheques to be mailed to you, opt-in for PayNow to receive faster payouts, direct to your account. Before you Opt-In âœ“ Check that youâ€™ve registered for PayNow using your NRIC or FIN with your bank. âœ“ Please note that this service: 1)Is only applicable for customers whose Singapore NRIC/FIN is in our policy records 2)Is only available for payouts in SGD and is currently available for selected payouts only 3)Will apply for policies where you do not already have an existing direct credit arrangement 4)Is not applicable for PayNow Mobile or PayNow UEN âœ“ By opting in, you agree to the terms and conditions for the receipt of funds via PayNow. For which transactions can I receive payouts via PayNow?
You can now opt in to receive payouts via PayNow for the following transactions: 1)Premium Refund due to 1.1.)Application not taken up 1.2)Policy Alteration 1.3)Unsuccessful Policy Application 1.4)Excess premium 1.5)Free look cancellation 2)Annuity Payout 3)Cash Bonus Withdrawal 4)Maturity Payout 5)Partial withdrawal (for PRUlink policy, PRUSelect series policy or PRUUniversal Vantage policy) 6)Life Claims Payment 6.1)Accident 6.2)Non-shield Hospitalization 6.3)Death 6.4)Critical Illness 6.5)Total Permanent Disability 6.6)Female/Male Benefit 6.7)Terminal Illness 6.8)Unemployment 7)Termination of policy (where there is a cash balance) If you have any enquiry, please call your financial consultant or our PRUCustomer Line at 1800 333 0 333 or Email Us..

PRUShield is a MediSave-approved Integrated Shield Plan which complements your MediShield Life with the option to pay your premiums with MediSave. PRUShield is also available for foreigners, as a private health insurance plan.
Want to learn more about PRUShield, head down to this link. If you have any enquiry, please call your financial consultant or our PRUCustomer Line at 1800 333 0 333 or Email Us..

values.text: PRULife Multiplier Flex is a whole of life plan that optimises your protection based on your needs, offering you coverage for death, Disability, Terminal Illness, and Critical Illness. With PRULife Multiplier Flex, you can choose to multiply your total coverage by 3 or 4 times and select the premium payment term thatâ€™s most suitable for you. This plan also has a cash value that can be accumulated over time. Protect your family against a multitude of uncertainties with PRULife Multiplier Flex today. Want to learn more about PRULife Multiplier Flex, head down to this link. If you have any enquiry, please call your financial consultant or our PRUCustomer Line at 1800 333 0 333 or Email Us..

DIRECT - PRUProtect Term is a regular premium term plan that provides financial protection in the event of Death, Terminal Illness, and Total and Permanent Disability. You can choose to be covered with a 20-year term plan or until the age of 65. The premium payment term will follow the chosen policy term, and the premium is guaranteed. Want to learn more about DIRECT - PRUProtect Term, head down to this link. If you have any enquiry, please call your financial consultant or our PRUCustomer Line at 1800 333 0 333 or Email Us..

DIRECT - PRUProtect Term 5 is a regular premium term plan that provides financial protection in the event of Death, Terminal Illness, and Total and Permanent Disability. You can choose to be covered with a 20-year term plan or until the age of 65. The premium payment term will follow the chosen policy term, and the premium is guaranteed. With DIRECT - PRUProtect Term 5, you will have the flexibility to renew your coverage every 5 years at a new premium based on your age upon renewal. Want to learn more about DIRECT - PRUProtect Term 5, head down to this link. If you have any enquiry, please call your financial consultant or our PRUCustomer Line at 1800 333 0 333 or Email Us..

DIRECT - PRUProtect Life, a participating whole life insurance plan that provides financial protection in the event of Death, Terminal Illness, and Total and Permanent Disability. Want to learn more about DIRECT - PRUProtect Life, head down to this link. If you have any enquiry, please call your financial consultant or our PRUCustomer Line at 1800 333 0 333 or Email Us..

PRUMortgage is a reducing term insurance plan that ensures your family will always have a shelter, by taking care of the outstanding mortgage payments should the unforeseen happen. Want to learn more about PRUMortgage, head down to this link. If you have any enquiry, please call your financial consultant or our PRUCustomer Line at 1800 333 0 333 or Email Us..

PRUMortgage Refund is a reducing term insurance plan that has a unique return-of-premium feature. It takes care of your outstanding mortgage loans should the unforeseen happen, ensuring that your family receives the protection they need. Want to learn more about PRUMortgage Refund, head down to this link. If you have any enquiry, please call your financial consultant or our PRUCustomer Line at 1800 333 0 333 or Email Us..

PRUWealth (USD) is an insurance savings plan that lets you earn healthy returns in the long run while enjoying the ability to withdraw your savings to fund key milestones of your life. You are guaranteed capital after 10 years and potentially higher returns. Want to learn more about PRUWealth (USD), head down to this link. If you have any enquiry, please call your financial consultant or our PRUCustomer Line at 1800 333 0 333 or Email Us..

PRULifetime Income helps you build towards your secure financial future that lasts across generations â€“ plan a comfortable retirement, support your childrenâ€™s needs or leave a lasting legacy. Want to learn more about PRULifetime Income, head down to this link. If you have any enquiry, please call your financial consultant or our PRUCustomer Line at 1800 333 0 333 or Email Us..

If you have any enquiry, please call your financial consultant or our PRUCustomer Line at 1800 333 0 333 or Email Us..

What is PRUshield Electronic Letter Of Guarantee (eLOG)? An eLOG is a service provided by Prudential to ease the burden of upfront hospital admission cost for Inpatient treatment or Day Surgery for PRUShield customers. This service is provided at the sole discretion of Prudential and is not contractual nor obligatory. It is also subject to the acceptance of participating hospitals. The amount of eLOG is up to $10,000 or the actual bill whichever is lower. Deductible, co-insurance, and pro-ration are applicable. Top-up is allowed but its approval is subject to the discretion of Prudential Claims Department. The eLOG is generated by the participating hospitals and not by Prudential Claims Department. PRUShield policy owner must agree on the terms and conditions of the eLOG by signing on the eLOG letter generated by the participating Hospital. Upon discharge, it is at the Hospital's full discretion if any payment is still required. This is in anticipation of a denial in the claim. Issuance of eLOG does not mean that Prudential admits the claim liability. All claims shall be assessed by Prudential Claims Department for its validity. Denied claims will not be entitled to any payment from Prudential. If you have any enquiry, please call your financial consultant or our PRUCustomer Line at 1800 333 0 333 or Email Us..

Making recurring payment using iPay. To set up a recurring payment for your regular premium policies in Singapore dollars, you may enrol in iPay. Your options are:
1)GIRO Enrolment
Log in to iPay.
Select Giro Enrolment [Only applicable for GIRO payment from DBS/POSB accounts]
Select your desired Policy Number(s)
Click to agree and acknowledge the important notes and terms and conditions, then proceed to enrol
iPay will redirect you to the DBS iBanking website. Please proceed to log in with your banking User ID and password
Enter the OTP sent from the bank to complete the transaction

2)Credit Card Enrolment
Log in to iPay.
Select Credit card Enrolment [Only applicable for Visa/Master credit cards]
Select your desired Policy Number(s)
Click to agree and acknowledge the terms and conditions, then proceed to enrol
iPay will redirect you to the credit card payment page. Please proceed to enter your credit card details
Enter the OTP sent from the bank to complete the transaction
Making one time payment using iPay. To make payment for your regular premium policies in Singapore dollars, you may make payment in iPay. Your options are:
1)PayNow
Log in to iPay.
Select Make payment via iPay
Select your desired Policy Number(s) and verify the payment amount
Select PayNow as the payment method
Payment details and a QR code will be generated
Separately, login in to your banking app
Scan the QR code or upload a screenshot of the QR code using the â€˜Scan and Payâ€™ function in your banking app
Ensure the merchantâ€™s name is (PRUDENTIAL ASSURANCE COMPANY (S) PTE LTD) and payment amount is correct
Proceed to confirm the payment
2)eNets
Log in to iPay.
Select Make payment via iPay
Select your desired Policy Number(s) and verify the payment amount
Select eNets as the payment method
iPay will redirect you to the eNets payment gateway
Select a bank and log in with your banking User ID and password
Enter the OTP sent from bank to complete the transaction
3)Credit Card
Log in to iPay.
Select Make payment via iPay
Select your desired Policy Number(s) and verify the payment amount
Select Credit card as the payment method
iPay will redirect you to credit card payment page. Please proceed to enter your credit card details
Enter the OTP sent from bank to complete the transaction
If you have any enquiry, please call your financial consultant or our PRUCustomer Line at 1800 333 0 333 or Email Us..

Health insurance is a type of insurance coverage that typically pays for medical, surgical, prescription drug, and sometimes dental expenses incurred by the insured. Health insurance can reimburse the insured for expenses incurred from illness or injury, or pay the care provider directly. If you have any enquiry, please call your financial consultant or our PRUCustomer Line at 1800 333 0 333 or Email Us..

Q: What disability insurance are there? A: Prudential Singapore offers a large variety of disability insurance plans which includes PRUActive Protect, PRUCancer 360, PRUActive Life, PRUActive Term, PRUMum, PRUFirst Promise, PRULady, PRUMan, and many more Want to know more? You can head over to this link. If you have any enquiry, please call your financial consultant or our PRUCustomer Line at 1800 333 0 333 or Email Us..

Q: What is disability insurance? A: Disability Insurance, often called DI or disability income insurance, or income protection, is a form of insurance that insures the beneficiary's earned income against the risk that a disability creates a barrier for completion of core work functions.
If you have any enquiry, please call your financial consultant or our PRUCustomer Line at 1800 333 0 333 or Email Us..

Q: Benefit of having disability insurance? generic.title: Frequently Asked Questions by Topics

values.text:
Q: What is Life Insurance? A: Life insurance is a contract between an insurance policyholder and an insurer or assurer, where the insurer promises to pay a designated beneficiary a sum of money in exchange for a premium, upon the death of an insured person.
If you have any enquiry, please call your financial consultant or our PRUCustomer Line at 1800 333 0 333 or Email Us..

Q: Benefit of having life insurance? A: If you're the primary provider for your dependents or have a significant amount of debt that outweighs your assets, insurance can help ensure your loved ones are well taken care of if something happens to you. Having a life insurance policy could also make sense if you own a business or you owe cosigned debts, such as private student loans, that someone else could be held responsible for if you pass away.
Want to know more? You can head over to this link.
If you have any enquiry, please call your financial consultant or our PRUCustomer Line at 1800 333 0 333 or Email Us..

Box 492 Singapore 900942 If you have any enquiry, please call your financial consultant or our PRUCustomer Line at 1800 333 0 333 or Email Us..

What is Assignment of Policy? Assignment of a life insurance policy means transfer of rights from one person to another. You can transfer the rights on your life insurance policy to another person/entity for various reasons. This process is referred to as Assignment and is governed under Policies of Assurance Act (Chapter 392). The person who assigns the insurance policy is called the Assignor (policy owner) and the one to whom the policy has been assigned, i.e. the person to whom the policy rights have been transferred is called the Assignee. Once the rights have been transferred from the Assignor to the Assignee, the rights of the policy owner terminates and the assignee becomes the owner of the insurance policy. Under Singapore law, only the Assignee can give a valid discharge of all payment obligations to the insurer. A notice of assignment must be given to the insurer at its principle place of business, and the date on which such notice was received shall regulate the priority of all claims under any assignment. If the premiums of the policy are not paid, whether by the assignor or the assignee, the policy may lapse. In the event that the policy is lapsed, the assignee will not be entitled to any benefits under the policy. Who can Assignment of Policy? Only the policy owner of the life insurance policy can assign the policy. If the assignor (i.e policy owner) is a natural person, he/she must have attained at least 18 years of age to assign a policy. The assignee, as a natural person, must also have attained at least 18 years of age at the assignment. How to Assignment of Policy? You must use relevant assignment form. While Prudential has assisted in preparing the assignment form, Prudential does not accept legal responsibility for the appropriateness of the assignment or its wordings or the effectiveness of the assignment or any other legal or tax consequences of this document in relation to any particular policy. If you have any doubts, you should consult a lawyer. Both assignor and assignee must read all instructions and notes stated in the assignment form before completing it with utmost due care. Only an original copy of the duly completed Deed of Absolute Assignment can be registered. The policy to be assigned must be in force and must not be subject to any Trust Nomination or under Housing Protection Scheme purposes at the time of the assignment. Where to submit the notice of Assignment? You must submit the completed assignment form and mandatory requirements/documents to Prudential Assurance Company Singapore (Pte) Limited at its principle place of business via one of the following ways: By Post to: Prudential Assurance Company Singapore (Pte) Limited Robinson Road P.O. Box 492 Singapore 900942 By Hand to: PRUCustomer Centre at Marina One The Heart #01-18/19, 5 Straits View Singapore 018935 If you have any enquiry, please call your financial consultant or our PRUCustomer Line at 1800 333 0 333 or Email Us..

Making payment online using GIRO. To set up a recurring payment for your regular premium policies in Singapore dollars, you may enrol for GIRO using these services. Please note that we can only accept GIRO payment from DBS/POSB accounts at this moment. Your options are:
1)PRUAccess
Login to your PRUAccess account.
Select your desired Policy Number
Select Change payment method to GIRO
Proceed to enrol
2)iPay
Log in to iPay.
Select Giro Enrolment [Only applicable for GIRO payment from DBS/POSB accounts]
Select your desired Policy Number(s)
Click to agree and acknowledge the important notes and terms and conditions, then proceed to enrol
iPay will redirect you to the DBS iBanking website. Please proceed to log in with your banking User ID and password
Enter the OTP sent from the bank to complete the transaction
3)DBS/POSB iBanking
The GIRO instruction will be activated within 5 working days
Login to your DBS iBanking
Select add a new GIRO arrangement
Select Prudential Assurance as the billing organisation
Input your Policy Number as the billing reference number
Hardcopy Application using GIRO. You may set up a GIRO arrangement by submitting a hardcopy form. Download and submit the Application for Premium Payment by Interbank GIRO Form. Please ensure that your signature matches that of your bank account records to avoid any delays or application rejection. The application process will take 3 to 5 weeks. If you have any enquiry, please call your financial consultant or our PRUCustomer Line at 1800 333 0 333 or Email Us..

How can I receive payments with cheque?
If you do not specify a payment method, we will mail a cheque to your registered mailing address with us. Be sure to keep us updated of your latest address. To check your latest records with us, you can login to PRUaccess to view your personal details.
If you have any enquiry, please call your financial consultant or our PRUCustomer Line at 1800 333 0 333 or Email Us..

Q: What is Medical insurance? A: Health insurance is a type of insurance coverage that typically pays for medical, surgical, prescription drug, and sometimes dental expenses incurred by the insured. Health insurance can reimburse the insured for expenses incurred from illness or injury or pay the care provider directly. If you have any enquiry, please call your financial consultant or our PRUCustomer Line at 1800 333 0 333 or Email Us..

Q: Benefit of having Medical insurance? A: 1. Itâ€™s way cheaper to start early
Insurance plans and packages vary according to your age. Essentially, the younger you are, the better the deal you get, which means a better premium at a cheaper price.
2. You qualify for a more comprehensive coverage
The younger and healthier you are, the higher the number of options you have, and you get to be as picky as you want about your medical plans. The older you get, you become more susceptible to illnesses â€“ so the fewer your options and you have to eventually settle for a plan that the insurance company can offer you.
3. Get early protection from lifestyle-related illnesses
Our lifestyles are constantly changing â€“ itâ€™s not the same as it was about 20 to 30 years ago. Most working professionals today resort to a more sedentary lifestyle, which has increased the likelihood of people suffering from hypertension, obesity, and more. The younger generation also lead lifestyles today where they consume plenty of junk food and fast food, as well as increased exposure to pollution. These can all lead to lung cancer, clogged arteries, heart attacks.
Want to know more? You can head over to this link.
If you have any enquiry, please call your financial consultant or our PRUCustomer Line at 1800 333 0 333 or Email Us..
